content:
• Tuesday, December 29, 2015
  • PBY-OLD

    Bridgestone won't counter Icahn's latest Pep Boys offer

    • It looks like Carl Icahn has won the Pep Boys (NYSE:PBY-OLD) bidding war: Bridgestone (OTCPK:BRDCY) says it won't counter Icahn Enterprises' (NYSE:IEP) $18.50/share offer for the auto repair shop chain. The offer, issued yesterday, topped a prior $17/share offer from Bridgestone.
    • PBY-OLD -2.7% after hours to $18.43.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM | 13 Comments
  • ON

    Fairchild receives new buyout offer; shares +4.4%

    • Two weeks after rejecting an unsolicited $21.70/share, all-cash, bid for the company, Fairchild Semi (FCS) says it has received a revised $21.70/share cash offer.
    • The board plans to "carefully review and consider" the revised offer. For now, its official recommendation of a $20/share deal to sell to ON Semi (NASDAQ:ON) remains unchanged. SA author Jaret Wilson has argued the ON deal undervalues Fairchild.
    • Fairchild has risen to $20.89 after hours. Bloomberg reported three weeks ago the original $21.70/share offer for Fairchild came from a Chinese group featuring China Resources Holdings' chip arm and investment firm Hua Capital.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: CREE +2.0%. SDRL +1.9%. FCS +0.8%. XIV +0.6%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: CHK -3.3%. MNK -2.9%. BCEI -2.3%. CMRX -1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM | 6 Comments
  • LAYN

    Layne Christensen closes up 5% after chairman discloses purchases

    • Layne Christensen (NASDAQ:LAYN) chairman David A.B. Brown has disclosed he bought 15K shares last Wednesday via two transactions respectively priced at $4.75 and $4.81.
    • The purchases came with the water, drilling, and construction service provider down over 50% from a 52-week high of $10.51. An FQ3 miss was posted 20 days ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • BOJA

    Breakout for Bojangles

    • Bojangles (NASDAQ:BOJA) is up 9.5% on heavy volume as shares broke over $16 for the first time in three weeks.
    • There was no major rating actions on the restaurant stock, although Bank of America Merrill Lynch snuck in a bullish upgrade right before the holidays last week.
    • SA contributor Josh Arnold has been bullish on Bojangles since the company reported Q3 numbers.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 4 Comments
  • SCON

    SCON up 40.5% after investor discloses 200K-share purchase

    • LeRoy Kopp, head of investment firm Kopp Holding, has disclosed he bought 200K Superconductor Technologies (NASDAQ:SCON) shares last Wednesday at $0.22 through an indirect purchase. Kopp's indirect stake now stands at 313K; direct holdings total 1.69M.
    • SCON's shares have rallied above $0.30. They're still down 89% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 3 Comments
  • AMCC

    AMCC, IPHI, LSCC rally as Intel discusses M&A plans

    • Telecom chipmaker and ARM server CPU developer AppliedMicro (AMCC +6.6%) is rallying after Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) M&A chief Wendell Brooks signaled more deals are likely following yesterday's closing of Intel's $16.7B purchase of FPGA developer Altera. As are telecom and data center analog/mixed-signal chipmaker InPhi (IPHI +4.2%) and FPGA/CPLD developer Lattice Semi (LSCC +7.7%).
    • Brooks: "We are looking for adjacencies where we can bring our [manufacturing] process advantage to bear. Altera is a great first acquisition ... We’re doing things very differently than we have in the past ... The market very much rewards companies like Avago that are leading the charge. I think the impetus will continue."
    • AppliedMicro has long been the subject of M&A speculation. Meanwhile, Lattice CEO Darin Billerbeck suggested in June his company is open to a sale.
    • Of note: AppliedMicro and Lattice's shares have often made big moves in the past in the absence of major news, and all three companies have betas well above 1.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 7 Comments
  • NYNY

    Empire Resorts lower after rights offering tipped

    • Shares of Empire Resorts (NYNY -12.6%) are sharply lower after the company discloses a right offering plan for common stock and Series B preferred shares.
    • The company plans to use the proceeds to help fund the development of the Montreign Resort Casino.
    • Previously: Upstate New York casinos get green light from gaming regulator (Dec. 23 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • MCD

    McDonald's clears the $120 level for the first time

    • McDonald's (MCD +0.7%) reached an all-time high of $120 today as it continues its slow upward trek after breaking out in October.
    • The successful runout of All-Day breakfast and the company's plan to refranchise up to 95% of its stores are seen as positive drivers for shares.
    • Recent restaurant traffic checks have shown positive same-store sales growth for the QSR category where McDonald's is the biggest player.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM | 22 Comments
  • CY

    Cypress +4%; CNBC reports of strong call-spread buying

    • RiskReversal.com's Dan Nathan observed on CNBC a trader bought 31K Cypress Semi (NASDAQ:CY) June 11/13 call spreads yesterday at $0.33 apiece. In effect, the trader is betting $1M Cypress (currently at $9.91) will be above $11.33 before the options expire.
    • Nathan speculates the trader could be wagering Cypress (closed a merger of equals with Spansion earlier this year) will be acquired as the semi industry's M&A wave continues. Two microcontroller rivals (NXP and Freescale) have merged this year, and another (Atmel) is weighing multiple buyout offers, with one of the suitors reportedly being yet another rival (Microchip).
    • Cypress, which is trading ex-dividend today, remains down 29% YTD; like many peers, a chip inventory correction has weighed on the company. Shares go for 15x a 2016 EPS consensus of $0.67.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 3 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: OTC:INVT +102%. CBIO +23%. FXCM +22%. SPP +19%. SKYS +12%. BORN +14%. OTC:ACUR +13%. REXI +13%. TGI +13%. EXFO +13%.
    • Losers: VKTX -19%. CAS -15%. GBSN -12%. AVXL -12%. AVGR -12%. NYNY -12%. HQCL -11%. NCTY -11%. KIQ -10%. [[cool]] -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • INVT

    Inventergy up 96.2% after receiving paid promotion

    • Inventergy (OTC:INVT) has soared on volume of 7.36M shares (far above a 3-month daily average of 278K) after receiving positive ink from Small Cap Traders.
    • Trader Michael Goode observes Small Cap Traders' parent company (Small Cap Specialists LLC) has disclosed it "has been compensated ten thousand dollars cash" to run a "3 day investor relations campaign of INVT."
    • Inventergy ($11M market cap) soared earlier this month after issuing a PR discussing recent deal activity. A 1:10 reverse split was carried out shortly before that.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 5 Comments
  • PRMW

    Primo Water on the move after Barrington nod

    • Primo Water (NASDAQ:PRMW) jumps 8.1% after Barrington Research upgrades the water dispenser seller to Outperform from Market Perform.
    • Barrington thinks Primo will top Q4 EPS estimates and sees shares at an attractive level after they suffered a sharp drop earlier this month.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • RBCN

    Rubicon +9.9%; new markets, PSS supply deal discussed in shareholder letter

    • In a letter to shareholders, Rubicon (NASDAQ:RBCN) states "a very well capitalized company" is evaluating the use of sapphire for what could be "a third major market" for the material (LEDs and mobile devices being the existing ones). "If they select sapphire, Rubicon is well positioned to become an important part of their supply chain. Meaningful volumes could begin later next year with significant ramp of this application projected in 2017 and beyond."
    • Rubicon adds "a major consumer electronics manufacturer" is sampling 6" sapphire wafers for potential use in non-LED chip production, potentially opening up another major market in 2017. And a medical device maker is thinking of using 6" wafers for medical monitoring equipment. "While this would not have the scale of the two markets previously mentioned, if this market materializes, it could generate sufficient demand within the next two to three years to absorb all of Rubicon’s current six-inch capacity."
    • Also mentioned: 1) Rubicon has been selected as a lead supplier of large patterned sapphire substrate (PSS) wafers by a major LED chip manufacturer. 2) "Increased sales opportunities" are expected for the optical market, with Rubicon's LANCE project (enables large, thick, sapphire windows) drawing interest from military and industrial firms. 3) Committed 2016 capex is "very limited." 4) Rubicon is limiting sales of lower-margin core and crystal growth products in favor of higher-margin offerings.
    • The letter comes at the end of a year that has seen Rubicon post major losses due to weak wafer sales and a brutal pricing environment - in the letter, Rubicon notes pricing for most sapphire products fell 35% in 2015. Shares are still down 73% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • TGI

    Triumph raised at Cowen after CEO hire

    • Cowen has upgraded Triumph Group (TGI +13.7%) to Market Perform from Underperform and lowered its price target on the stock to $37 from $40.
    • Analyst Cai von Rumohr said recruiting Dan Crowley as CEO is a solid hire and brings Triumph a seasoned A&D executive with a strong track record of operational success. The analyst also noted that TGI shares appear "washed out."
    • Previously: New chief at Triumph Group (Dec. 29 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • QTRH

    WiLAN up 6.4% after announcing Kyocera licensing deal

    • WiLAN (WILN) has signed a multi-year licensing deal with Japanese phone and telecom equipment maker Kyocera. The deal settles a lawsuit in Texas' Eastern District.
    • Kyocera seems to be in a licensing mood: InterDigital announced a deal with the company yesterday.
    • Last week: WiLAN jumps on Netflix licensing deal
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • MEET

    MeetMe higher after reporting daily chat milestone

    • MeetMe (MEET +3%) states over 30M "chats" were sent through its platform on Monday, a new daily record. The company notes it reached 20M daily chats for the first time a year ago.
    • Shares are close to a 52-week high of $3.44. They rose earlier this month after MeetMe reported its mobile monthly active users grew 27% Y/Y in November to 4.04M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • LKM

    NQ Mobile reports receiving 100% of NationSky payout; shares +3.3%

    • A week after reporting it had received 80% of the cash owed for the $80M sales of enterprise mobility software/services provider NationSky, NQ Mobile says it has been paid in full.
    • Still no word on when NQ and other FL Mobile shareholders will receive payment for their $626M or greater deal to sell FL Mobile to Tsinghua Holdings and "an independent third party."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM | 17 Comments
  • AVXL

    Anavex Life Sci reports fiscal year results; shares sink 19% premarket on subpoena disclosure in 10-K

    • Micro cap Anavex Life Sciences (NASDAQ:AVXL) reported fiscal 2015 results this morning. Its cash balance is $15.3M (+110%) after a net loss of ($12.1M) (-21.0%).
    • The stock is down 19% premarket on robust volume in apparent response to its disclosure in its 10-K (page F-34) that it received a subpoena from the SEC on December 22 related to its formal investigation of recent trading activity in the company's shares. The firm intends to cooperative fully with the SEC's inquiry.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 21 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:15 am

    • Gainers: NURO +28%. DNR +7%. PBY-OLD +7%. FXCM +6%. LINE +6%. CMRX +6%. OAS +6%. WLL +5%.
    • Losers: AVXL -19%. SUNE -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM | 16 Comments
  • ASTI

    Ascent discloses new patent; shares +24.4%

    • CTO Joseph Armstrong: "As Ascent pioneers the next generation of CIGS (Copper-Indium-Gallium-di-Selenide), this novel back contact, and the improvements related to our demonstrated ability to manufacture our PV on thinner plastics will lead to significant application opportunities not only in Ascent's aerospace products, but in the Company's EnerPlex consumer products as well."
    • Shares have risen to $0.17 premarket. They're still down 84% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 9 Comments
  • AVXL

    Anavex Life Sciences reports FY'15 earnings

    • Anavex Life Sciences (NASDAQ:AVXL): FY'15  EPS of -$0.65
    • Cash of $15.3M.
    • Shares -19.3% PM.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • CMRX

    Bargain hunters jump into Chimerix; shares up 6% premarket

    • Bargain hunters continue to take positions in Chimerix (NASDAQ:CMRX). Shares are up 6% premarket on robust volume. The stock collapsed over 81% yesterday after the company announced that brincidofovir failed a late-stage study in preventing CMV infection in patients undergoing hematopoietic cell transplants. Most of yesterday's 26.5M-share turnover occurred after the plunge.
    • Previously: Chimerix's lead product candidate flunks late-stage study; shares plummet 73% premarket (Dec. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 5 Comments
  • NURO

    NeuroMetrix launches DPNCheck in Mexico; shares up 26% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap NeuroMetrix (NASDAQ:NURO) is up 26% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement that it closed its first order for DPNCheck in Mexico. The device, used to evaluate systemic neuropathies such as diabetic peripheral neuropathy (DPN), will initially be used by one of the country's six major government healthcare institutions to improve the detection of diabetic neuropathy and advance its management of diabetes patients.
    • The device measures conduction velocity and response to amplitude of the sural nerve, located in the lower leg and ankle. The parameters are recognized as biomarkers of DPN.
    • Mexico has one of the highest rates (12% of the population) of type 2 diabetes in the world.
    • DPNCheck is distributed in Mexico by Scienta Farma S.A. de C.V.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • GME

    GameStop on watch after Pacific Crest warns

    • Shares of GameStop (NYSE:GME) are on watch after Pacific Crest calls the retailer the "big holiday loser" of the season.
    • The investment firm notes that weak holiday traffic reinforces the negative impact of digital channels on the GameStop business model.
    • Pac Crest recommends that investors stay on the sidelines with GameStop.
    • GameStop closed at $28.49 yesterday vs. a 52-week range of $27.90 to $47.83. In a bullish view, SA contributor Josh Arnold thinks the +5% yield on GameStop provides a backstop for investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • FCX

    Freeport rebounds after yesterday's plunge

    • Freeport McMoRan (NYSE:FCX) +2% premarket, bouncing back from a 9.5% loss on Monday following the resignation of co-founder James Moffett.
    • Previously: Freeport-McMoRan sinks after chairman resigns (Dec. 28 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM | 12 Comments
